infos.value: ...Brother, there's too many of them...
Just have faith in yourself...and in me, Velne. We'll get through this.
...Right.
Who goes there!?
You don't seem like Galzahk's henchmen...
Oh, Galzahk is an acquaintance of yours?
You're...with the Church, I take it?
That is correct. I am Sadali of the Crystal Sanctum.
I'm Garvall. This is my sister, Velne.
...I see.
No offense, but I have no intention of befriending Galzahk.
Well then, that means that there will be no need for conflict between us.
The Crystal Sanctum and the Arms Dealers' Guild don't get along?
I feel inclined to ask the same of you and Galzahk...
Would you mind telling me what has befallen you?
It was a wise decision to decline the invitations of a villain such as Galzahk.
Is he really that bad?
Galzahk and his guild's arrogant conduct have earned them the ire of every nation in the land.
Not only do they pressure the weaponsmiths who oppose them, they are uncompromising even in their dealings with the greater nations.
Should they be left to their machinations, there will be an endless cycle of war for which the people will pay the greatest price.
The time has come for the Arms Dealers' Guild to undergo a change.
...Why tell us that?
You speak as if you wish not to be involved.
Galzahk's guild is a blight.
Alas, we must take into account that many weaponsmiths make their livelihoods thanks to the very business the guild provides.
...I could swear you're about to say you want me to take over the guild.
The people of Yezagh need power in order to escape the ever-looming shadow of persecution.
...Do you not agree?
You're aware of my background.
All are equal beneath the Crystal. Discrimination must not be allowed to prevail. To achieve this...
I see where this is going, but how do you expect me to take the guild from someone like Galzahk?
You shall be aided by my monks.
However...once the deed is done, I will need the Sanctum's involvement in this matter to remain unknown.
Unwarranted misinformation only impairs the Sanctum's efforts to spread the word of the Crystal, you see.
Why do you turn to a man you know so little about...?
The people of Yezagh have suffered immeasurable discrimination and persecution.
Knowing such a horrific history has a way of bringing forth one's sympathies.
And you believe that placing the Arms Dealers' Guild in his hands will guarantee the future and human dignity of his people...?
Heh heh heh, such a reality is but a dream of the most fanciful kind.
A world without war is something we simply cannot have, after all.
Heh heh heh...
